body_html:
Keep in mind that a lot of the functions in tf.contrib.seq2seq have been rewritten in object-oriented style (on github master). So for example: tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder and tf.contrib.seq2seq.attention_decoder_fn_train no longer exist. a new attention mechanism is being pushed by next week. a new decoder already exists but is object oriented.
…
On Fri, Mar 10, 2017 at 10:33 AM, Brandon McKinzie ***@***.*** > wrote: Anyone working on this? I've been using dynamic_rnn a lot lately and would be happy to write the requested documentation. I've been looking to start contributing here and this seems like a good issue to start with. — You are receiving this because you were assigned. Keep in mind that a lot of the functions in tf.contrib.seq2seq have been
rewritten in object-oriented style (on github master).  So for example:

tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder

and

tf.contrib.seq2seq.attention_decoder_fn_train

no longer exist.  a new attention mechanism is being pushed by next week.
 a new decoder already exists but is object oriented.

body:
Keep in mind that a lot of the functions in tf.contrib.seq2seq have been
rewritten in object-oriented style (on github master).  So for example:

tf.contrib.seq2seq.dynamic_rnn_decoder

and

tf.contrib.seq2seq.attention_decoder_fn_train

no longer exist.  a new attention mechanism is being pushed by next week.
 a new decoder already exists but is object oriented.

On Fri, Mar 10, 2017 at 10:33 AM, Brandon McKinzie <notifications@github.com
> wrote:

> Anyone working on this? I've been using dynamic_rnn a lot lately and would
> be happy to write the requested documentation. I've been looking to start
> contributing here and this seems like a good issue to start with.
